data.text: @TravellingTabby @NoraDonnelly7 Wonder if the weather is part of the explanation for whatâ€™s already happened with the trend in the ons survey?
@NoraDonnelly7 I'm not really sure what is happening! Hopefully it settles down soon though as we start to see some nicer weather
@beith123 For the normal case figures it might, but the figures mentioned above are from the ONS infection survey, so they won't be affected by different levels of testing
@TravellingTabby Thks is alarming,what's happened,any explanation for it?

@TravellingTabby Are we testing more up here, than in England, for example?
Would perhaps help explain the differences in case detections?
@TravellingTabby This has to be a reporting and testing issue  if there is no requirement people simply aren't testing

@electric_shes @paulgarb54 @TravellingTabby It'll be interesting to see hospital figures when positive cases don't need to isolate. 😫 Family members are clinically vulnerable, it's a worry. Here's to brighter days ahead!
@TravellingTabby Flew in last night from south west Spain where life is not totally abnormal to Glasgow. Back under house arrest.
@paulgarb54 In comparison to England, we've had less of the virus for pretty much the entire winter. It might just be a case of that catching up to us https://t.co/D7FpzPp4El
